The relationship between temperature and stability in thermodynamic systems is multifaceted and can be understood through the lens of several key concepts, including thermodynamic stability, phase transitions, and the behavior of chemical reactions.

### 1. Thermodynamic Stability

Thermodynamic stability refers to the tendency of a system to remain in a particular state. In general, systems tend to minimize their free energy. The most common forms of free energy used in thermodynamics include Gibbs free energy (G) and Helmholtz free
